words.definition: To bring to a conclusion; to finish.
words.example: We will end the meeting soon.

words.definition: A planned piece of work; to estimate or forecast something based on present trends.
words.example: The science project is due tomorrow. We project growth next year.

words.definition: To bring oneâ€™s hand or a tool or weapon into contact with someone or something quickly and forcefully; a successful venture.
words.example: He hit the ball. The song was a hit.

words.definition: The lowest part or edge of something; to use as a foundation.
words.example: The base of the statue is wide. Base your answer on facts.

words.definition: A luminous point in the night sky; a famous or talented person; to feature as a principal performer.
words.example: The sky was full of stars. She will star in the movie.

words.definition: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs.
words.example: Put the book on the table.

words.definition: A tribunal presided over by a judge; an area marked out for a game or sport.
words.example: The court made a decision. They played tennis on the court.

words.definition: To make or manufacture from components or raw materials; things that have been produced or grown, especially by farming.
words.example: Factories produce cars. The market sells fresh produce.

words.definition: To put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it.
words.example: We eat dinner at six.

words.definition: To give instruction or lessons to someone.
words.example: She will teach math next year.

words.definition: A viscous liquid derived from petroleum, especially for use as a fuel or lubricant.
words.example: Check the oil in your car.

words.definition: Either of two equal or corresponding parts into which something is or can be divided.
words.example: Cut the apple in half.

words.definition: A set of circumstances in which one finds oneself; a state of affairs.
words.example: The situation is under control.

words.definition: Achieved without great effort; presenting few difficulties.
words.example: This test is easy.

words.definition: An amount that has to be paid or spent to buy or obtain something; to require the payment of.
words.example: What is the cost of this book? It will cost $10.

words.definition: Economic activity concerned with the processing of raw materials and manufacture of goods.
words.example: The automobile industry is growing.

words.definition: A number, especially one that forms part of official statistics or relates to the financial performance of a company; to calculate or work out.
words.example: What is the sales figure? Can you figure out the answer?

words.definition: To confront and deal with or accept.
words.example: You must face your fears.

words.definition: A public road in a city or town, typically with houses and buildings on one or both sides.
words.example: They live on Main Street.

words.definition: A representation of the external form of a person or thing in art.
words.example: The image was blurry.

words.definition: Reflexive form of 'it'.
words.example: The cat cleaned itself.

words.definition: A device used for voice communication; to call someone by telephone.
words.example: My phone is ringing. Phone me later.

words.definition: Used before the first of two alternatives; one or the other.
words.example: You can choose either option.

words.definition: Facts and statistics collected together for reference or analysis.
words.example: The data shows an increase in sales.

words.definition: To put something on top of or in front of something in order to protect or conceal it; a thing that lies on, over, or around something.
words.example: Cover the pot with a lid. The book cover is blue.

words.definition: To the utmost or most absolute extent or degree; absolutely; completely.
words.example: She is quite right.

words.definition: A painting, drawing, or photograph; to represent in a photograph or picture.
words.example: Take a picture of the sunset. I can't picture him as a doctor.

words.definition: Easy to perceive, understand, or interpret; to remove objects or obstructions from.
words.example: The sky is clear. Please clear the table.

words.definition: The actual application or use of an idea, belief, or method; to perform an activity repeatedly.
words.example: Practice makes perfect. She practices piano every day.

words.definition: A portion of an object or of material, produced by cutting, tearing, or breaking the whole.
words.example: Can I have a piece of cake?

words.definition: The part of the earth's surface that is not covered by water; to come down through the air and rest on the ground or another surface.
words.example: They bought a piece of land. The plane will land soon.

words.definition: Having happened or started only a short time ago.
words.example: I read a recent article.

words.definition: To give an account in words of someone or something, including all the relevant characteristics, qualities, or events.
words.example: Can you describe the man you saw?

words.definition: An article or substance that is manufactured or refined for sale.
words.example: This is our best-selling product.

words.definition: A person who is qualified to treat people who are ill.
words.example: The doctor will see you now.

words.definition: A continuous vertical brick or stone structure that encloses or divides an area of land.
words.example: Hang the picture on the wall.
